Technique: PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL; PAINTED; FAYENCE
Name: Royal cartouche
Description: This object in white and grey-blue faience probably served as an inlay in an architectural decoration. The cartouche, which is surmounted by the solar disk and by two plumes, contains the "King of Upper Egypt and Lower Egypt" name of Sethos II. The reverse bears an assembly mark ("Per Sakhmet").
